programme.title: Speed S1 - "Into Space"
programme.desc: The most innovative area of human motion lies not on Earth, but with the exploration of space. Meet the private space entrepreneurs jostling to offer the tantalizing prospect of cheap, frequent travel beyond the atmosphere into Earth orbit.

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "Saving Venice"
programme.desc: MOSE is one of the largest and highest-profile civil-engineering works. But will it be able to save Venice? Venice has grappled with inundation for centuries.

programme.title: TechKnow S1 - "Curing Cancer"
programme.desc: An innovative gene therapy has produced a significant breakthrough that could lead to a cure for cancer.

programme.title: TechKnow S1 - "The Longevity Gene"
programme.desc: Studying the genes and lifestyles of centenarians. The results may offer answers to living longer and fighting diseases.

programme.title: TechKnow S1 - "The Science Of Water Sustainability"
programme.desc: Looking at solutions for water scarcity from fog catching nets to water efficient washing machines.

programme.title: TechKnow S1 - "The Science Of Sugar"
programme.desc: Exploring the correlation between sugar intake and heart disease in young adults.

programme.title: VR 101 S1 - "Education"
programme.desc: Can students just simply put on VR headsets and “attend”class from the comfort of their own homes? In this episode, we take a look at some of the latest VR apps for school education and after school VR games.

programme.title: VR 101 S1 - "Safety"
programme.desc: VR can be used in practical applications like training and road safety, but find out how that sensory overload can lead to error in judgment.

programme.title: VR 101 S1 - "Gaming"
programme.desc: This episode looks at the development of VR content and hardware meant to improve on the ‘reality’ of VR and the latest games featuring novel and exciting virtual worlds.

programme.title: VR 101 S1 - "TV&Film"
programme.desc: The art of moving visuals has long been used to evoke emotion and empathy in the viewer. Film and TV productions are implementing VR to give viewers an immersive experience where it’s just like “being there”.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S1 - "Schapbo"
programme.desc: John Rambo’s ability to decimate enemies all by himself has created some of the most incredible weapon stunts in Hollywood history. We test the reality surrounding these iconic scenes from this blockbuster franchise.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S1 - "Terry and the Minigun"
programme.desc: Can you really fire a GE Minigun handheld with ammunition held in a backpack (also seen on Captain America: Winter Soldier). Additionally, for one of our larger tests – can you actually chop down a jungle forest with a minigun?

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S1 - "Scoreless"
programme.desc: Using a unique method to crack a safe, Nick Wells (Robert De Niro) uses a blowtorch to cut through a safe, fill it with water, and blow the door off using a small explosive device.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S1 - "Terry Vs Gorn"
programme.desc: Captain James T Kirk’s battle with the Gorn alien is one of the most popular episodes from the original series. He defeats the Gorn by creating gunpowder from the base elements found on the planet.

programme.title: Engineering the Future S1 - "Fusion"
programme.desc: It is the greatest technological challenge ever undertaken by humankind. The quest to produce the ultimate energy solution... fusion.

programme.title: Engineering the Future S1 - "Tidal"
programme.desc: The power of the ocean's tides is the last great untapped energy source on Earth. Teams of engineers race to perfect the technology to harness the vast flowers of water.

programme.title: Engineering the Future S1 - "Maritime"
programme.desc: Shipping companies and engineers are creating new machines to make their industry greener using a resource that has moved man across oceans for thousands of years... winds.

programme.title: Engineering the Future S1 - "Solar"
programme.desc: The sun is the biggest source of energy in the solar system. Innovators are searching for new ways to capture more of the sun's power.

programme.title: Shark Dive TV S1 - "Shark Feeding Frenzies"
programme.desc: Shark Dive TV studies Whale Sharks kept in a giant tank and then takes a Deeper Dive by explaining shark hearing, shark feeding frenzies and Great White Sharks.

programme.title: Shark Dive TV S1 - "Sharks Electrosensory Systems"
programme.desc: Shark Dive TV dives with Bull Sharks in Cancun, Mexico and analyzes sharks electrosensory systems.

programme.title: Race of Life S1 - "Underwater Prey's Defenses"
programme.desc: Life in the ocean demands constant adaptation for survival. From camouflage to group safety, animals employ various strategies to evade predators and secure food.

programme.title: Wildlife Heroes S1 - "Maria Diekmann"
programme.desc: The Californian Maria Diekmann founded the Rare and Endangered Species Trust, REST in short, to provide care for injured and endangered animals.

programme.title: Wild Ones S1 - "STRONGEST"
programme.desc: Wild Ones draws inspiration from the rhythms of nature, delving into the wonders of the animal kingdom. This captivating series explores the diverse behaviors that define survival—hunting and feeding strategies, family bonds, defense tactics, and the intricacies of courtship and mating. Who reigns supreme in the wild? Discover the untold stories of nature's fiercest competitors and most fascinating creatures.

programme.title: Wild Ones S1 - "FASTEST"
programme.desc: Wild Ones draws inspiration from the rhythms of nature, delving into the wonders of the animal kingdom. This captivating series explores the diverse behaviors that define survival—hunting and feeding strategies, family bonds, defense tactics, and the intricacies of courtship and mating. Who reigns supreme in the wild? Discover the untold stories of nature's fiercest competitors and most fascinating creatures.

programme.title: Blue World S6 - "Exploring Devil’s Hole Cave in Nevada"
programme.sub-title: Exploring Devil’s Hole Cave in Nevada
programme.desc: Would you believe that one of the largest aquifers in the United States is located directly beneath Death Valley?

programme.title: Blue World S6 - "Hunting for Megalodon Shark Teeth"
programme.desc: Blue World heads to a dark, murky river in South Carolina to hunt for Megalodon shark teeth on the river bed. It’s some of the most dangerous, spooky diving ever!

programme.title: Super Senses 2: Special Forces S1 - "ELITE CORPS"
programme.desc: Survival demands an edge. Witness some of the animals whose elite sensory abilities put them at the top of their game.

programme.title: Destruction Decoded S1 - "Megafloods"
programme.desc: Witness the devastating destructive power unleashed by planet earth’s most valuable resource – water.

programme.title: Destruction Decoded S1 - "Constructions"
programme.desc: Discover the worst bridge collapses and tunnel fires in history.

programme.title: Destruction Decoded S1 - "Hurricanes"
programme.desc: Explore with us one of the most destructive and deadliest hurricanes in history!

programme.title: Wonder S1 - "Phenomenal"
programme.desc: In this episode we learn the diference between Iridescence, Chemiluminescence and Bioluminescence. We also learn about Gemstone Coloration and Mechanical Plant Defenses.

programme.title: Survival Science S1 - "Surviving a Bear Attack"
programme.desc: Nick and Laura create kick-ass tests to explore the immense power and startling speed of grizzly bears. They use Hollywood stunt tools to experience an attack. Then try to recreate a “miracle” arrow shot that saved a man from being killed by a bear.

programme.title: Survival Science S1 - "Surviving Treestand Accidents"
programme.desc: In this exciting episode we’ll find out the reasons why tree stand accidents happen and how we can prevent them. Cool science mixed with dynamic experiments send our hosts, our stunt team and our special crash test dummies plummeting to the ground.

programme.title: Survival Science S1 - "Sniper Attack"
programme.desc: Military snipers are trained in a variety of skills: detection, stalking, camouflage, infiltration, special reconnaissance and target acquisition. Bottom line, a ton of cool shooting and science for Nick and Laura to explore!

programme.title: Survival Science S1 - "Surviving a Lightning Strike"
programme.desc: Laura and Nick travel to a state-of-the-art Direct Effects Lightning Test Lab. With some “explosive” experiments, they’ll determine the power lightning and how it behaves? And they’ll find out how can hunters and fishermen best protect themselves?

programme.title: Trajectory S1 - "Satellites Lost & Found"
programme.desc: BEYOND EARTH ORBIT - The Apollo program takes bold new steps. IXV RE-ENTRY VEHICLE - Europe is working to perfect a re-entry vehicle. GALILEO SATELLITES LOST AND FOUND - Navigation satellites go into incorrect orbit.

programme.title: Trajectory S1 - "To the Moon"
programme.desc: TO THE MOON - The Apollo program achieves its major objective. DRAGON, FALCON AND SPACEX - New directions in re-usable spacecraft. GAIA - Mapping our galaxy in unprecedented detail.

programme.title: Trajectory S1 - "End of Apollo"
programme.desc: THE BEGINNING OF THE END - After the first Moon landing the Apollo science program was about to start in earnest but people were losing interest. APOLLO GETS COMPLICATED - New technology is added that extends the reach of the Apollo program.

programme.title: Trajectory S1 - "Return to Space"
programme.desc: THE SHUTTLE PROGRAM - The first re-useable spacecraft. THE CHALLENGER DISASTER - Pressing launch schedules lead to carelessness and the loss of the Challenger. RETURN TO SPACE - A re-designed shuttle is back in space with a redefined role.

programme.title: Space Dealers S1 - "Risk Taking, Money Making"
programme.desc: Torie and Larry duke it out on the auction floor for an incredible artefact. Cole meets astronaut Scott Parazynski who risked his life on one of the most daring spacewalks ever.
